title: Reform UK at LCC: 9 Months of Transformation by the Numbers
summary: From a £28 million inherited overspend to near zero. From 48% savings delivery to 100% target. From maximum council tax rises to the lowest in 12 years. Here's what Reform UK has actually delivered at Lancashire County Council — with the data to prove it.

title: The £350 Million Bond Scandal the Conservatives Concealed
summary: £519 million invested in VeLTIP bonds now worth an estimated £169 million — a paper loss of £350 million that the previous Conservative administration failed to transparently report to councillors or the public. Reform exposed the true scale.
author: Lancashire CC Transparency

title: Council Tax Myth Busted: Reform's 3.80% vs the Conservatives' Seven Years of Maximum Rises
summary: Critics claim Reform 'broke a promise' on council tax. The data tells a different story: the Conservatives raised council tax to the legal maximum in 7 of their 8 years in control, including the highest rise in Lancashire's history at 5.99%. Reform's 3.80% is the lowest in 12 years.

title: Care Homes: How Reform Listened, Reversed, and Invested — Despite Inheriting a £50M Savings Gap
summary: After consulting 1,600+ residents, Reform reversed initial closure proposals and pledged new investment in all 5 care homes — despite inheriting a requirement to find £50 million in adult social care savings from the underfunded Conservative legacy.

title: Pension Fund Reform: How Company Directors' Fees Were Stopped
summary: Reform halted excessive company directors' fees being charged on pension fund investment vehicles, with the national DOGE team providing advisory support on bond valuations and fee analysis — savings described as 'a key piece of work that will save council taxpayers a lot of money'.

title: Fact-Checking the Media: What Byline Times and North West Bylines Got Wrong About Reform at LCC
summary: Headlines claiming Reform would 'bin DOGE' and 'preside over £46 million overspend' don't survive contact with the actual financial data. The overspend was inherited — and Reform eliminated it. The DOGE efficiency review identified £22 million in savings. Here are the facts.

title: Lancashire County Council: £3.6 Billion Across 753,220 Transactions
summary: The largest dataset on the AI DOGE platform — 753,220 transactions totalling £3.6 billion to 11,482 suppliers. LCC's fraud triangle score of 77.1 is the highest in Lancashire, with £93.6 million in likely duplicates and a 14.7x year-end spending spike.
